newsitem.title: USA: Pharmacyclics drugs set for more trials.
newsitem.headline: Pharmacyclics drugs set for more trials.

text.p: Pharmacyclics Inc said a committee of the National Cancer Institute (NCI) has approved more trials of the drugs gadolinium texaphyrin (Gd-Tex) and lutetium texaphyrin (Lu-Tex).

Gd-Tex, a radiation sensitizer, and Lu-Tex, a photosensitizer, are based on Pharmacyclics's texaphyrin technology. They will be studied for their uses in treating several types of cancer, the company said.
Pharmacyclics and NCI are in the process of structuring a cooperative research and development agreement in which NCI will sponsor multiple clinical trials.

Pharmacyclics will collaborate on the design of clinical studies and selection of tumor indications. NCI will pay for certain studies at various NCI-funded institutions and through cooperative groups.
Pharmacyclics shares were up 7/8 at 22-3/8 at midday.
